\vec{E}(P)= k_e\int \frac{dq}{|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|^2} \hat{r}_{dq\to P}  
\]

title: 1  Campo eléctrico debido a un alambre con carga
text:
Integral de línea de una función escalar





\[
\int_{\mathcal C} f(\vec{r}) d\ell = \int_{a}^{b} f(\vec{r}(t)) |\vec{r}'(t)| dt
\] donde \(\vec{r}:[a,b]\to \mathcal{C}\) es una parametrización de la curva \(\mathbfcal{C}\) tal que \(\vec{r}(a)\) y \(\vec{r}(b)\) son los extremos de \(\mathcal{C}\) y \(a<b\).



Dibujo del alambre con densidad de carga
\[
\vec{E}(P)= k_e\int_{\mathcal{C}} \frac{dq}{|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|^2} \hat{r}_{dq\to P}  = k_e\int_{\mathcal{C}} \frac{\lambda(\vec{r}_{dq})d\ell}{|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|^2} \hat{r}_{dq\to P}
\]
Parametrización a lo largo del alambre \[
\vec{r}_{dq}(t) = \left[\begin{array}{c}
x(t)\\
y(t)\\
z(t)
\end{array}\right] =
\left[\begin{array}{c}
a + \ell t\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]
\]
Entonces,
\[
\vec{r}_{dq\to P} = \vec{r}_P - \vec{r}_{dq} = \left[\begin{array}{c}
0\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]-\left[\begin{array}{c}
a+\ell t\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]=\left[\begin{array}{c}
-(a+\ell t)\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]
\]
Norma al cuadrado \[
|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|^2 = \left[\begin{array}{c}
-(a+\ell t)\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]\cdot \left[\begin{array}{c}
-(a+\ell t)\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right] = (a+\ell t)^2
\]
Norma \[
|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}| = (a+\ell t)
\]
\[
\hat{r}_{dq\to P} = \frac{\vec{r}_{dq\to P}}{|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|} = \frac{1}{|\vec{r}_{dq\to P}|}\vec{r}_{dq\to P} = \frac{1}{(a+\ell t)} \left[\begin{array}{c}
-(a+\ell t)\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right]=\left[\begin{array}{c}
-1\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right] = -\left[\begin{array}{c}
1\\
0\\
0
\end{array}\right] = -\hat{\imath}
\]
crumbs: 1  Campo eléctrico debido a un alambre con carga

title: 2  Campo Eléctrico debido a un anillo
text:
Mostrar código
from pylab import *
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly
print(plotly.__version__)

a = 4
t = linspace(0,1)
z = a*cos(2*pi*t)
y = a*sin(2*pi*t)
x = zeros_like(t)

eje_x = linspace(0,6)
eje_y = zeros_like(x)
eje_z = zeros_like(x)


DATA = [
go.Scatter3d(x=x,y=y,z=z,mode='lines',
             line=dict(color="red",width=20),showlegend=False),
go.Scatter3d(x=eje_x,y=eje_y,z=eje_z,mode='lines',
             line=dict(color="black",width=4),showlegend=False)
]
fig = go.Figure(data=DATA)
fig.update_layout(
    title=r'$\\alpha$',
    width=400, height=400,
    margin=dict(t=40, r=0, l=20, b=20)
)

camera = dict(
    up=dict(x=0, y=1, z=2),
    center=dict(x=0, y=0, z=0),
    eye=dict(x=0.0, y=-2.5, z=0.0)
)

fig.update_layout(scene_camera=camera)

fig.show()


5.19.0


                                                




Mostrar código
from pylab import *
m = 0.0123
g = 9.8
theta = 17.4*pi/180
q = -1.11e-6
Ex = m*g*tan(theta)/q
print(Ex)


-34031.48308853118




Mostrar código
kappa1 = 3.9
eps0 = 8.85e-12
A = 7.9e-4
d = 4.6e-3
C1 = kappa1*eps0*A/(d/2)
print(C1)

kappa2 = 11.68
eps0 = 8.85e-12
A = 7.9e-4
d = 4.6e-3
C2 = kappa2*eps0*A/(d/2)
print(C2)

Ceq = 1/(1/C1+1/C2)
print(Ceq)


1.1855152173913045e-11
3.550466086956522e-11
8.887559524473963e-12
